intro: Metastelma jamaicense, commonly known as Jamaican starfruit, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean. It belongs to the family Cucurbitaceae, which includes cucumbers and gourds. The plant produces small, yellow, star-shaped fruits that are edible and have a tart flavor. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates with well-drained soil. Its botanical features include tendrils for climbing and heart-shaped leaves.
